result.execSummary:
The defendant David R Geocaris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI 6th, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay fine of $4800 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted, if any, shall be applied.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Count 1 and Consecutive to 13CF881.

*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: 3 1/2 yrs WSP; 1 1/2 yrs Initial followed by 2 yrs ES.  Not eligible for CIP, but eligible for SAP

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Brenda VanCuick.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.   
Count 1 - DE is sentenced to 3 1/2 years in the WSP forthwith.  1 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.  Credit for 279 days.   Court imposes a fine of $4800 plus costs & surcharge.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 36 months.  AODA Assessment and Ignition Interlock ordered.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  

Count 4 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions and is Consecutive to Count 1 and consecutive to 13CF881.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Court costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 

Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.

Atty Henderson states DE wants new counsel.   DE requests he be allowed 2 weeks to retain his own attorney.  Court holds motion for withdraw of counsel in abeyance at this time.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 10:40 am.

15CF645/15CF647/13CF881/15TR9358/15TR9359
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Douglas Henderson.  Clerk: PT
Atty Henderson appears along with Atty Brenda VanCuick.  Atty Henderson states he has been appointed to represent DE in 15CF645 and 15CF647 and also agrees to represent DE is 13CF881 in place of Atty VanCuick.  Atty Henderson requests the trial scheduled in 13CF881 be removed from the courts calendar at this time and a status date be set on all files.  Upon hearing statements court grants request.  Status conference scheduled for all files on October 28, 2015 at 10:30 am.

NO RECORD TAKEN:  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared specially for Atty Trigg and for the State.  Atty Douglas Henderson appeared.  Clerk: PT
Parties met in chambers and a request to adjourn today's hearing was granted by the court off the record.  Status Conf. on 9/16/15 at 10:10 AM.

Defendant David R Geocaris appeared with Attorney Douglas I. Henderson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Matter set with DE's other file 15CF645. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.
